entry.title: Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (23)
entry.content:
Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (23)20130906
I'm finding Dante Must Die to be easier than Son of Sparda. First,
the boss in Mission 1 had a programming error and didn't move at
all, so I just wailed on him and won simply. Next, I found the
Dreamrunner enemies to be much easier to parry than before, I
think because they attack faster. Finally, in mission 3 I realized
I could just jump over the gap right away and skip the mission!

Game     2:  8:12
Game     3:  1:03
Total time: 19:43
  • Video Games
  • DmC: Devil May Cry
  • PS3
  • 2013

entry.title: Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (5)
entry.content:
Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (5)20130906
I read an interesting excerpt this morning about how you can
contract to be killed in punishment, but you cannot contract to not
resist when someone comes to kill you. The idea is that you can
only make agreements that benefit your freedom and preservation of
yourself. It was an interesting point. He brought up that this is
why criminals who "accept justice" and are due for execution are
brought about in chains and with armed guards, because resistance
is expected.
  • Books
  • 1651

entry.title: Movie: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1, starring Kristen Stewart (2011)
entry.content:
Movie: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1, starring Kristen Stewart (2011)20130905
This was an awesome movie. I was surprised that they were able to
cut it when they did and that they could film some many things
well. For instance, I found the honeymoon to be really sweet and
cute without being dumb or racy. I thought it was awesome when you
finally heard the pack-think and Jacob's resistance. The makeup and
acting around the birth was great too. The "imprinting" was the
best those. I don't remember the book as well, but I feel like they
greatly embellished the wolves' actions around the birth so that
this part could have a big conflict. I think it worked fine.
  • Movies
  • 2011

entry.title: Movie: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse, starring Kristen Stewart (2010)
entry.content:
Movie: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse, starring Kristen Stewart (2010)20130904
This was the last Twilight movie I saw in theatres and I saw it on
opening night and never since. It was pretty great. Some of the
lines and moments are just amazing. You really feel for Jacob in
this one a lot too. I feel like they really ramped up Bella's
makeup because Stewart became more of a star and needed to be seen
beautiful at all times.
  • Movies
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Tales of Xillia (PS3, 2011) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Xillia (PS3, 2011) (8)20130903
I played today for about two hours. I got the next character and
made my way to the Gorge. In the second area, I jumped down and
fought some really tough boss-like creature. It was tough, but
rewarding. I like how the new character behaves in combat and it
seems like the game is really fair about letting everyone get some
XP. I think I will try to balance all the characters, rather than
focus on just a few.

Total time: 13:34
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Xillia
  • PS3
  • 2011

entry.title: Movie: The Twilight Saga: New Moon, starring Kristen Stewart (2009)
entry.content:
Movie: The Twilight Saga: New Moon, starring Kristen Stewart (2009)20130903
I remember not liking this movie as much as the others because
Bella is such an emo wimp during it, but in this viewing I like it
a lot more. Jacob is so chiseled it's amazing. The "phasing" into
werewolves was very cool.

entry.title: Movie: Twilight, starring Kristen Stewart (2008)
entry.content:
Movie: Twilight, starring Kristen Stewart (2008)20130902
We watched this to start off a Twilight marathon. I remember
watching this when it came out and I have always recalled it as
being done poorly compared to the later movies, but upon watching
it I feel that it was done just as well. There were some really
great moments... I think the introductory Biology class scene was
amazing. I love it when Carlisle says "Remember who you are" to
Edward.
  • Movies
  • 2008

entry.title: Movie: Epic, starring Amanda Seyfried (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Epic, starring Amanda Seyfried (2013)20130901
This was a really fun movie. It had a lot of good action, some
really funny moments, and great visuals. I though the voice actors
were top notch. We all watched it as a family and everyone was
impressed. The very late title card was pretty epic too.

entry.title: Game: Tales of Xillia (PS3, 2011) (6)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Xillia (PS3, 2011) (6)20130827
I played today for about three hours and got past the Jiao fight.

The new characters are interesting. It is especially strange how
many voice actors were also in Persona: Teepo sounds like Chie and
Elize sounds like Nanako, and then Jude is Teddy.

There was a really funny dialogue scene where Milla doesn't like
the picture of her on a Wanted poster and Jude has to reassure her
that she is pretty. It reminds me of the other funny instances
where she says that her servant (a guy) picked out her outfit and
that the Wind God, Slyph, does her hair.

I'm conflicted about Alvin. They're making him seem really
sketchy, but of course he has to be good eventually because you
spend so many resources on him. I wonder what will happen.

I though the fight with Jiao was /very/ hard. I use about 5 Life
bottles and had a lot of tough tactical moments, especially with
his monster summoning.

I think it is weird that the Lilium Orbs (the character
progression system) are a part of the character's world and that
they acknowledge their existence. I don't really understand what
they're supposed to mean to the characters.

Total time: 10:57
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Xillia
  • PS3
  • 2011

entry.title: Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (4)
entry.content:
Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (4)20130827
In discussing the importance of words and language:

"A naturall foole that could never learn by heart the order of
numerall words, as one, two, and three, may observe every stroak of
the Clock, and nod to it, or say one, one, one; but can never know
what houre it strikes."
  • Books
  • 1651
